column35: £9/22/2011 : If Aegis Angel leaves the battlefield, you no longer control it.£9/22/2011 : If Aegis Angel and the permanent would be destroyed simultaneously, only Aegis Angel will be destroyed.£7/1/2013 : If another player gains control of Aegis Angel, the permanent will no longer have indestructible, even if you regain control of Aegis Angel.
column39: Flying #_(This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)_#£When Aegis Angel enters the battlefield, another target permanent gains indestructible for as long as you control Aegis Angel. #_(Effects that say "destroy" don't destroy it. A creature with indestructible can't be destroyed by damage.)_#

column23: #_Dwarves have an instinct for repair, an inherent understanding of how systems work, and a reputation for fearlessness. They're perfect candidates for the Fair's emergency response team._#
#_"Arise. You have been anointed by the light. Go forth and fight without fear, for you shall be victorious."_#
column39: {T}: Target attacking creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
